Localize Rings
The package &LocalizeRingForHomalg; defines the classes of local(ized) rings, local ring elements and local matrices. These three objects can be used as data structures &homalg; can rely on to do homological computations.
A &homalg; local ring element contains two &homalg; ring elements, a numerator (&see; ) and a denominator (&see; ). A &homalg; local matrix contains a global &homalg; matrix as a numerator (&see; ) and a ring element as a denominator (&see; ). The constructors for ring elements and matrices are and .
The local rings most prominently can be used with methods known from general &homalg; rings. The methods for doing the computations are presented in the appendix (), since they are not for external use. The new attributes and operations are documented here.
